page.title: 02Hatfield Broad Oak Village
page.content: Situated some 27 miles from London and 5 miles from Bishop's Stortford, the nearest market town, Hatfield Broad Oak is today a quiet village showing few signs of its former importance. In the middle ages the church formed part of a Benedictine Priory and the village was a well-known centre. Today most of its inhabitants go out of the village to work, some travelling as far as London each day. In the central and most ancient part of the village near the church all of the houses are over one hundred years old and many date back to Tudor times or even earlier. There is also much more recent housing, some of it decidedly less picturesque than the ancient cottages in the High Street and Cage End.
